page.title: 02Kirkby Industry:Early Years
page.content: In 1940 during the war, a Royal Ordnance Factory was built on the outskirts of Liverpool near the village of Kirkby. It was dispersed over a wide area and made ammunition detonators. In April 1946 the factory site was handed over to Liverpool Corporation to develop as an industrial estate. The town of Kirkby was built as an overspill centre for people being rehoused from clearance areas in central Liverpool and as a home for employees of the rapidly expanding and thiving industrial estate. The estate's area was 380 hectares and in 1959 over 27,000 people were employed in a multitude of firms engaged in the manufacture of a tremendous variety of domestic, light and heavy engineering and food products. {
